ARABIC: وَفِى ثَمُودَ إِذْ قِيلَ لَهُمْ تَمَتَّعُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: And also in Thamud, when they were told: 'Enjoy yourselves a while!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And in Thamud, when We said to them: "Enjoy yourselves for a while;"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: There is also a Sign for you in (the story of) Thamud. They were told: “Enjoy yourselves for a while.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: There is also evidence (of the Truth) in the story of the Thamud, who were told to enjoy themselves for an appointed time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And in the tribe of Thamud when it was told to them, “Enjoy for a while.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And in Thamud, when they were told: "Enjoy yourselves for a while!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And in Samood: When it was said to them: Enjoy yourselves for a while.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And also in Thamood, when it was said to them, 'Take your enjoyment for a while!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And in (the tribe of) Thamud (there is a portent) when it was told them: Take your ease awhile.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: In the Thamud [there was another sign], when they were told, "Make the most of your lives for a while."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And in Thamud's also was a lesson, when it was said Unto them: enjoy yourselves for a season.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And in Thamud, when they were told, ‘Enjoy for a while.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And in the Thamud (was another Sign): Behold, they were told, "Enjoy (your brief day) for a little while!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And in Thamud (there is also a sign), when they were told: "Enjoy yourselves for a while!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And in Thamood it was said to them: 'Take your enjoyment for awhile'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And in Thamood. They were told, “Enjoy yourselves for a while.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And in Thamud, when it was said to them, "Enjoy yourselves for a time."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [51:43] And [also] in, the destruction of, Thamūd, was a sign, when it was said to them, after the hamstringing of the she-camel, ‘Enjoy [yourselves] for a while!’, until the end of your terms [of life] — as stated in the [other] verse, ‘Enjoy [yourselves] in your dwellings for three days’ [Q.11:65].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And in (the tribe of) Thamud) the folk of Salih ((there is a portent) when it was told them) Salih told them after they hamstrung the she-camel: (Take your ease awhile) enjoy your life until the advent of the chastisement.
